Lock Your Node.js App Into Single-Instance Mode with Ease!

Node Locksmith is an elegant and straightforward Node.js module that ensures your application runs as a single instance, preventing multiple executions that could lead to data corruption or unexpected behavior. Imagine a world where starting your app twice is impossible – that's the peace of mind Node Locksmith offers! Whether you're managing batch jobs, cron tasks, or any other Node.js scripts, Node Locksmith keeps them unique so your system stays safe and predictable. ### 🌟 Features - Effortless Integration: Just a few lines of code to make your app single-instance. - Automatic Lock Management: Creates and releases locks without a fuss. - Customizable Behaviors: Decide how your app responds to duplicate runs. - Cross-Platform Support: Works on both Windows and Unix-like systems. - Safe & Secure: Ensures only one instance manages crucial tasks at a time. ### 💻 Installation Getting started with Node Locksmith is a snap! Run this command: npm install node-locksmith ### 🚀 Quick Start Here's how simple it is to use Node Locksmith: ``` // Import the LockManager class const LockManager = require('node-locksmith'); // Create a new instance with optional custom settings const lockManager = new LockManager({ lockFileName: 'myApp.lock' // Customize your lock file name }); lockManager.initializeTerminationHandlers(); // Initializes termination event handlers for graceful application shutdown. async function main() { // Check and create a lock before running your app logic await lockManager.checkLock(); await lockManager.createLock(); // Your app logic goes here } // Start your app with LockManager in control main(); ``` And voilà – you're now running with a robust single-instance lock! ### 🛠 Configuration Node Locksmith's configuration is both flexible and straightforward: | Option | Description | Default | | ------------------ | -------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------- | | lockFileName | Name of your lock file. | 'app.lock' | | lockFileDir | Directory for the lock file. | \_\_dirname (your app dir) | | killTimeout | Time to wait before terminating previous instance (in ms). | 5000 | | waitForExitTimeout | Time to wait for the old instance to exit (in ms). | 10000 | | checkInterval | Interval to check if the previous instance has exited (in ms). | 500 | | maxRetries | How many times to retry lock acquisition. | 3 | ### 🛡️ Robust Exception Handling & Real-Life Scenarios #### Exceptional Reliability in Every Scenario We've accounted for an extensive range of scenarios in which your Node.js applications might operate, taking the heavy lifting of error handling off your shoulders. Here are some of the situations we've carefully tested and handled for you: - Concurrent Launch Attempts: When multiple instances try to start simultaneously, Node Locksmith gracefully ensures only one takes control, while the rest are either terminated or remain uninitiated based on your configuration. - Orphaned Lock Files: Sometimes applications crash or are terminated abruptly, leaving behind lock files without a running instance. Our module intelligently detects these orphaned locks, removes them, and allows your app to start cleanly. - Permission Issues: In the event of lock files being created with the wrong permissions, Node Locksmith provides informative error messages and recovery suggestions, making it easier for you to rectify such issues without delving into confusing system errors. - Process Termination: If an existing instance needs to be closed to allow a new one to start, our module handles SIGTERM signals to shut down the previous instance safely, ensuring data integrity and proper resource cleanup. - Timeout and Retry Logic: Network file systems and other I/O operations can be unpredictable. Node Locksmith comes with a sophisticated timeout and retry mechanism that stands guard against transient issues, making sure your lock acquisition doesn't fail due to temporary glitches. #### Beyond Exception Handling: The Peace of Mind Guarantee - With Node Locksmith, you're not just getting a module but a promise of peace of mind. - Once integrated, the module requires no manual intervention. You set it up once, and it runs as intended, every time. ### 📈 Keep It Up-to-Date Node Locksmith uses semantic versioning. To ensure you have the latest improvements and fixes, keep it updated using npm: npm update node-locksmith ### 📦 Dependencies node-locksmith utilizes the following third-party libraries: - ps-node: A process lookup utility for Node.js. Make sure to check out their documentation for more details on how they work. ### Troubleshooting Encountering issues can be a hiccup in developing great applications. If you run into any problems with node-locksmith, here are some common issues and their respective solutions. #### 1. Lock File Issues Issue: The lock file is not created where expected or is prematurely deleted. Solution: - Ensure the lockFileDir directory is writable by the application. If unspecified, process.cwd() is used by default. - Check for external processes or scheduled clean-up jobs that might modify or delete files in the lock file directory. #### 2. Permission Errors Issue: Encountering permission errors when trying to create, write, or delete the lock file. Solution: - Review file system permissions and user ownership for the lock file directory. - On Unix-like systems, consider proper permission management or running the process with elevated privileges (sudo) if appropriate. #### 3. Concurrent Launch Failures Issue: Multiple instances seem to bypass the lock mechanism, running simultaneously. Solution: - Modify checkInterval and maxRetries configuration parameters to give instances more time or attempts to acquire the lock. - Double-check that the lock file path is consistent across instances and no instance-specific paths are being used. #### 4. Signal Handling Issue: Application doesn’t release the lock after receiving a termination signal. Solution: - Ensure lockManager.initializeTerminationHandlers() is called during application setup. - Avoid overriding default signal handlers that may prevent node-locksmith from performing clean-up tasks. #### 5. Failed to Exit Previous Instance Issue: The application does not terminate the previous instance when requested. Solution: - The previous process may require more privileges to be terminated. Run the new instance with adequate permissions, or manually terminate the older one. - Investigate whether the operating system’s process management settings are interfering with signal delivery. #### 6. Incorrect PID in Lock File Issue: The lock file contains an invalid or old PID, causing conflicts. Solution: - Ensure the application closes cleanly to update or remove the lock file. - Add additional error handling to detect when the PID in the lock file does not correspond to a running process. #### 7. Delayed Lock Release on Exit Issue: The lock file remains after the application exits. Solution: - Confirm that clean-up code executes correctly and listen to the correct events for process termination. - Look out for asynchronous operations that may delay the process’s exit and subsequently delay the lock release. #### 8. Module Import Errors Issue: TypeScript definitions are missing or not found, resulting in import errors. Solution: - If using TypeScript, ensure you’ve included type declarations for node-locksmith, or create a .d.ts file declaring module typings. - Check that the module is installed correctly under node_modules and is not corrupted. #### 9. Unexpected Behavior Issue: Experiencing erratic behavior or errors that are not covered by the guide. Solution: - Check the Node.js version for compatibility issues; update Node.js or node-locksmith if necessary. - Review the project’s GitHub issues for similar problems, or report a new issue with detailed information about the Node.js version, operating system, stack trace, and steps to reproduce the error. For issues beyond these common scenarios, please open an issue on the node-locksmith GitHub repository with as much detail as possible. The Table of Contents (TOC) in Markdown files works using anchor links that correspond to headings in the document. The anchor link is created by taking the text of the heading, converting it to lowercase, replacing spaces with hyphens (`-`), and removing punctuation and special characters. This anchor is then prefixed with a `#` symbol to create the link.

In your TOC, you've used custom anchor names that don't match your headings. Here's an example of how to adjust the TOC links so they directly correspond to the headings in your document.

**Updated Table of Contents (with Matching Anchors):**

```markdown
## Table of Contents

1. [Introduction](#introduction)
2. [Features](#-features)
3. [Installation](#-installation)
4. [Quick Start](#-quick-start)
5. [Configuration](#-configuration)
6. [Robust Exception Handling & Real-Life Scenarios](#-robust-exception-handling--real-life-scenarios)
   - [Exceptional Reliability in Every Scenario](#exceptional-reliability-in-every-scenario)
   - [Beyond Exception Handling: The Peace of Mind Guarantee](#beyond-exception-handling-the-peace-of-mind-guarantee)
7. [Keep It Up-to-Date](#-keep-it-up-to-date)
8. [Dependencies](#-dependencies)
9. [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting)
   - [Lock File Issues](#1-lock-file-issues)
   - [Permission Errors](#2-permission-errors)
   - [Concurrent Launch Failures](#3-concurrent-launch-failures)
   - [Signal Handling](#4-signal-handling)
   - [Failed to Exit Previous Instance](#5-failed-to-exit-previous-instance)
   - [Incorrect PID in Lock File](#6-incorrect-pid-in-lock-file)
   - [Delayed Lock Release on Exit](#7-delayed-lock-release-on-exit)
   - [Module Import Errors](#8-module-import-errors)
   - [Unexpected Behavior](#9-unexpected-behavior)
10. [Credits](#-credits)
11. [Author](#-author)
12. [Feedback and Contribution](#-feedback-and-contribution)
13. [License](#-license)
```

When you're using emojis or special characters in your headings, the anchors won't include those. Each link in your TOC needs to match the automatically generated anchor that GitHub creates.

Here are a few examples of how to correctly convert headings to anchor links:

**Heading:** `### 🛡️ Robust Exception Handling & Real-Life Scenarios`
**Anchor Link:** `[Robust Exception Handling & Real-Life Scenarios](#-robust-exception-handling--real-life-scenarios)`

**Heading:** `### 🌟 Features`
**Anchor Link:** `[Features](#-features)`

Note that emojis are typically removed from the auto-generated anchor links.

After correcting the links in your TOC to match the headings, clicking on them should navigate to the corresponding sections within your README. If after making these adjustments some links are still not functioning, it may be due to special characters in the headings that GitHub handles differently. You might need to review each heading anchor in the rendered README to ensure the TOC links are accurate.

where else can i publish my package to get more downloads ?

To increase the visibility and downloads of your Node.js package, consider the following platforms and strategies:

1. **npm Registry**: Clearly the starting point as your package needs to be available on npm (which seems likely since you're tracking downloads).

2. **GitHub**: Ensure you have a good README with clear instructions and examples. Use relevant tags to make it more discoverable. Encourage users to star the repository if they find the package useful.

3. **Blogging Platforms**:
   - Write a blog post on **Medium**, **Dev.to**, or your personal blog about your package. Explain the problem it solves and how it can be used.
   - Consider guest posting on well-known tech blogs that allow contributors.

4. **Developer Forums and Communities**:
   - Share and discuss your package on forums like **Stack Overflow**, **Reddit** (subreddits like r/node, r/javascript, or r/webdev), and **Hashnode**.
   - Participate in **Hacker News**, particularly on Show HN for new projects.

5. **Social Media**:
   - Share on LinkedIn, as you are planning, and also on Twitter using relevant hashtags like #nodejs, #npm, #javascript, #opensource, etc.
   - Join Facebook groups or LinkedIn groups where developers share tools and libraries.

No worries, we can start from a specific folder or aspect that you're most interested in. Let's start with the controllers folder since it's a crucial part of the application's logic. Could you provide me with the files inside the controllers folder?

Thank you for providing the code files. Let's start by understanding the `AdminController` class in the `Project.Controllers` namespace.

The `AdminController` class is responsible for handling administrative tasks in the online learning management system. It has the following methods:

1. `AdminController(IAdminService adminService)`: This is the constructor of the `AdminController` class. It takes an `IAdminService` parameter and assigns it to the `_adminService` field.

2. `Create()`: This method is decorated with the `[Authorize(Roles ="Admin")]` attribute, which means that only users with the "Admin" role can access this method. It returns a view for creating a new course.

3. `Index()`: This method is also decorated with the `[Authorize(Roles ="Admin")]` attribute. It retrieves all courses from the `_adminService` and passes them to the view. The courses are then displayed in the view.

4. `Create(CourseToAddDto course)`: This method is decorated with the `[HttpPost]` attribute, which means it handles the HTTP POST requests. It takes a `CourseToAddDto` object as a parameter, which represents the data for creating a new course. It awaits the `_adminService.CreateCourse(course)` method, which creates a new course using the provided data.

5. `Detail(Guid id)`: This method takes a `Guid` (unique identifier) parameter `id` representing the course ID. It retrieves the course with the matching ID from the `_adminService` and passes it to the view for displaying course details.

6. `Edit(Guid id)`: This method takes a `Guid` parameter `id` representing the course ID. It retrieves the course with the matching ID from the `_adminService` and creates a `CourseToAddDto` object containing the course details. It returns the view for editing the course, passing the `CourseToAddDto` object.

7. `Edit(Guid id, CourseToAddDto _courseDto)`: This method handles the HTTP POST requests for editing a course. It takes the course ID (`id`) and the updated course details (`_courseDto`). It checks if the model state is valid and then retrieves the course with the matching ID from the `_adminService`. If the course exists, it creates a new `Course` object with the updated details and calls the `_adminService.UpdateCourse(editedCourse)` method to update the course. If the course does not exist, it returns the view.

8. `Delete(Guid ID)`: This method takes a `Guid` parameter `ID` representing the course ID. It retrieves the course with the matching ID from the `_adminService` and passes it to the view for confirming the course deletion.

9. `DeleteClub(Guid id)`: This method handles the HTTP POST requests for deleting a course. It takes the course ID (`id`) and retrieves the course details from the `_adminService`. If the course exists, it calls the `_adminService.DeleteCourse(id)` method to delete the course.

10. `UserManager()`: This method is decorated with the `[Authorize(Roles = "Admin")]` attribute, which means that only users with the "Admin" role can access this method. It retrieves all users from the `_adminService` and passes them to the view for managing user accounts.

These are the main methods in the `AdminController` class. Each method performs different actions related to administrative tasks, such as creating courses, managing courses and users, and deleting courses. - Heart Note: Hints of vanilla and warm amber provide a comforting embrace, evoking a sense of tranquility and contentment.

The fragrance’s soothing properties help maintain emotional balance and composure in tense situations.

Description:
Twilight Serenade Perfume is a captivating fragrance that comes in an intricate bottle, reminiscent of the twilight sky. The bottle is adorned with delicate motifs depicting celestial stars and moons, capturing the essence of a magical evening. The perfume itself shimmers with a mesmerizing glow, inviting you to experience the enchantment it holds within.

Usage:
To immerse yourself in the allure of Twilight Serenade, apply a small amount to the tops of your feet, ankles, and the insoles of your shoes or along the seam or welt of your stockings. Each step you take will release whispers of seduction and elegance, leaving behind a trail of captivating fragrance.

Fragrance Notes:
1. Top Note: Peppermint - The top note of Twilight Serenade awakens your senses with a refreshing burst of invigorating peppermint. This cooling note stimulates and uplifts, creating a sense of anticipation for the captivating experience to come.

2. Heart Note: Patchouli and Vetiver - The heart of the perfume unveils a delicate balance between patchouli and vetiver. The earthy and aromatic essence of patchouli intertwines with the smoky and woody essence of vetiver, creating a harmonious blend that evokes the raw enchantment of twilight.

3. Base Note: Pheromone-infused Ylang-Ylang - As the perfume settles, the base note emerges, infused with pheromones that enhance its seductive power. The rich and floral aroma of ylang-ylang captures the essence of passion and allure, enveloping you in its captivating embrace.

4. Accent Note: Amber - A subtle accent note of amber weaves throughout the fragrance, adding warmth and sensuality. The golden hues of amber create a magnetic aura, intensifying the allure and creating an irresistible aura.

Benefits:
- Alluring Stride: When wearing Twilight Serenade Perfume, you gain advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to move silently or remain unnoticed. The captivating scent melds with your movement, obscuring your presence from prying eyes.

- Enigmatic Seduction: Once per long rest, you can activate the Enigmatic Seduction ability. For the next hour, anyone within a 30-foot radius of you has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws against being charmed. The alluring fragrance of Twilight Serenade weaves a seductive web, ensnaring the hearts and minds of those who come near.

- Enchanting Melody: While wearing Twilight Serenade Perfume, the range of your Bardic Inspiration feature is increased by 10 feet. The captivating fragrance enhances the resonance of your voice, allowing your melodic whispers to reach even the farthest corners of the room, captivating and inspiring your allies.

- Seductive Charisma: The enchanting aroma of Twilight Serenade Perfume empowers your charisma and presence. While wearing the perfume, you gain a +2 bonus to Charisma checks made to establish rapport, negotiate favorable terms, or foster romantic connections. The beguiling fragrance amplifies your natural allure, enhancing your ability to weave spells of persuasion and captivate the hearts of others.

The experimental variables in injection molding can include the type of plastic material used, the temperature and pressure of the injection molding machine, the design of the mold, and the cooling time. give me a short composition about Young people can only entertain in front of a screen

Young people today often turn to screens for entertainment, whether it be in the form of binge-watching television shows, scrolling through social media, or playing video games. While there is certainly nothing wrong with enjoying screen time in moderation, it is important to recognize the drawbacks that come with relying too heavily on technology for entertainment.

Firstly, too much screen time can have negative effects on physical health. Sitting for extended periods of time in front of screens can lead to poor posture, eye strain, and even obesity. Secondly, excessive screen time can negatively impact mental health. Studies have linked excessive screen time to an increased risk of depression and anxiety, as well as a decreased ability to focus and learn.

Furthermore, relying solely on screens for entertainment can limit young people's social skills and creativity. Spending time with friends and family, engaging in outdoor activities, and pursuing hobbies that don't involve technology can foster interpersonal skills and creativity that are valuable for personal growth and development.

In conclusion, while screens can be a convenient and enjoyable source of entertainment, too much reliance on them can have negative effects on both physical and mental health, as well as limit social skills and creativity. Young people should aim to balance screen time with other forms of entertainment and experiences that promote overall wellbeing.
Give me an experimental summary of material forming.

Material forming is a process of transforming materials into desired shapes through various manufacturing processes, including forging, rolling, extruding, and stamping. In the experimental summary of material forming, several variables can be considered, including the type of material, the temperature, and pressure applied during the forming process.

In forging, the material is heated, and pressure is applied to shape it into the desired form. Experiments can be conducted to determine the effect of heating temperature, forging speed, and pressure applied on the quality of the resulting forged product.

Similarly, in rolling, a metal slab is passed between rollers, where it is compressed and shaped into the desired thickness. The experimental variables in rolling can include the temperature of the material, the speed of the rollers, and the number of passes through the rollers. Experiments can be conducted to determine how variations in these variables affect the quality of the final rolled product.

Extruding is another material forming process that involves forcing material through a shaped die. The experimental variables in extruding can include the temperature of the material, the size and shape of the die, and the pressure applied. Experiments can be conducted to determine how these variables affect the dimensions and quality of the extruded product.

Finally, stamping is a material forming process that involves shaping materials into specific shapes and sizes using dies and punches. The variables in stamping can include the pressure and temperature applied, the type of material being stamped, and the shape and size of the die. Experiments can be conducted to determine how variations in these variables affect the quality of the stamped product.

In conclusion, material forming experiments can involve many variables, including temperature, pressure, and die shape and size. Understanding how these variables affect the quality of the resulting product is critical to optimizing material forming processes for maximum efficiency and product quality.

I understand. Here is a basic overview of card counting in poker:

Card counting is a strategy used by experienced poker players to gain an advantage by tracking the ratio of high cards (10, J, Q, K, A) and low cards (2, 3, 4, 5, 6) that are dealt during a poker game. When the ratio of high cards to low cards is favorable, the player can increase their bets to maximize their winnings.

Here are the steps for counting cards in poker:

1. Assign a value to each card. In the Hi-Lo method, the high cards (10, J, Q, K, A) are assigned a value of -1, while the low cards (2, 3, 4, 5, 6) are assigned a value of +1. The remaining cards (7, 8, 9) are assigned a value of 0.

2. Keep a running count of the values of the cards as they are dealt. Start the count at 0 and add/subtract the values of each card as it is revealed.

3. Determine the true count. The running count needs to be adjusted based on the number of decks that are being used in the game. To determine the true count, divide the running count by the number of decks that have not been dealt.

4. Use the true count to decide when to bet. When the true count is positive, the player has an advantage and can increase their bets. When the true count is negative, the player does not have an advantage and should avoid placing large bets.

It is important to note that while card counting is not illegal in all jurisdictions, it is not allowed in most casinos and can result in being banned from the casino. Additionally, card counting in a private game with friends may be considered cheating and can damage relationships.
